intro: Primula coreana, commonly known as the Korean primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to the early season landscape.
